intro: Manettia tomentulosa, commonly known as the woolly manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly white pubescence that covers its stems and leaves, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique texture and visual appeal.
